title: Citi and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi to Partner with MyGoodDeed to Commemorate 9/11 as a National Day of Service and Remembrance
summary: New York – Citi and the New York Mets Alumni Association presented by Citi announced today that they will team up with the nonprofit MyGoodDeed to help commemorate the 10th anniversary of the attacks of September 11 by encouraging people to perform good deeds, support charitable causes, volunteer and engage in other acts of service. The project is part of the Mets and Citi's "Teammates in the Community" initiative, reflecting their ongoing commitment to be active participants in the community.
tag-1: Citi and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi to Partner with MyGoodDeed to Commemorate 9/11 as a National Day of Service and Remembrance
tag-3: New York – Citi and the New York Mets Alumni Association presented by Citi announced today that they will team up with the nonprofit MyGoodDeed to help commemorate the 10th anniversary of the attacks of September 11 by encouraging people to perform good deeds, support charitable causes, volunteer and engage in other acts of service. The project is part of the Mets and Citi's "Teammates in the Community" initiative, reflecting their ongoing commitment to be active participants in the community.
tag-4: MyGoodDeed annually organizes the 9/11 Day of Service and Remembrance ("9/11 Day"), which seeks to provide a positive and forward-looking way for Americans and others to forever honor and remember the victims, survivors and the many that rose in service in response to the tragedy, including first responders, recovery workers, volunteers, public safety officers and members of our military. For the 10-year anniversary of 9/11, MyGoodDeed is partnering with another prominent nonprofit, HandsOn Network, the volunteer activation division of the Points of Light Institute, to organize the single largest day of charitable service in U.S. history.
tag-5: David Paine, president and co-founder of MyGoodDeed, started the 9/11 Day of Service and Remembrance in 2002 along with his friend Jay Winuk, vice-president and co-founder, who lost his younger brother Glenn Winuk, an attorney and volunteer firefighter, in the line of duty at the World Trade Center. David's original idea was inspired by a story he had read soon after the attacks which reported that members of the 2001 Mets organization, including players, planned to donate a day's wages to the relief efforts.
tag-6: Citi and Mets alumni will take part in a series of activities to support MyGoodDeed and its mission. This Friday, September 9, the alumni, including Mike Piazza, will visit local New York City firehouses, continuing the outreach efforts started by the 2001 team. Later in the day at Citi Field, the players will assist 50 Citi volunteers in distributing "I Will" pledge cards to fans before the Mets host the Chicago Cubs at 7:10 p.m. The pledge cards encourage fans to visit the 9/11 Day of Service and Remembrance website, at 911day.org, and post what they will do to remember and pay tribute this September 11 through good deeds and other forms of charitable service. Matt Franco, John Olerud, Steve Trachsel and Robin Ventura are among the alumni to be on hand for the "I Will" pledge card drive.
tag-7: On Sunday, September 18, a few lucky Mets fans will play in a charity softball game at Citi Field and get coached and cheered on by Mets greats. All proceeds will be donated to MyGoodDeed.
tag-8: "Citi is proud to support the inspiring work of David, Jay and MyGoodDeed to commemorate every September 11 as a National Day of Service and Remembrance," said Bob Annibale, Global Director of Citi Community Development. "There is no better way to pay tribute to those we lost, to survivors and to first responders than to create the positive message of service in their honor."
tag-9: Additionally, the Mets Alumni and Citi executives will present MyGoodDeed's Paine and Winuk with the "Teammates in the Community Award" during a special pre-game ceremony Friday night. The award recognizes individuals who have demonstrated extraordinary ways to give back to the community, and they will be honored for their commitment and dedication to serving and helping others by encouraging Americans to volunteer and give back in honor of the 9/11 attacks.
tag-10: "Although it has now been nearly a decade since the 9/11 tragedy, it is still very fresh in my mind and that of many New Yorkers, and we are so thankful to collaborate on this meaningful observance with Citi and especially the New York Mets, who played such a meaningful role in inspiring our original idea through their own commitment to charitable service right after 9/11," said Paine.

tag-13: 9/11 Day  The 9/11 Day Observance was originally conceived in 2002 by David Paine, along with Jay Winuk, a 9/11 family member, to provide a positive and forward-looking way for Americans and others to forever honor and remember the 9/11 victims, survivors, and the many that rose in service in response to the 9/11 tragedy. In 2009, September 11 was officially recognized under bi-partisan federal law as a National Day of Service and Remembrance. For the 10-year anniversary of 9/11, the 9/11 nonprofit group, MyGoodDeed, founded by David and Jay, is partnering with HandsOn Network and many other leading organizations to organize the single largest day of charitable service in United States history.
